### Reproduces the problem - code sample

I am using the official config of MVXNet, the config file are as follow:
```_base_ = ['../_base_/schedules/cosine.py', '../_base_/default_runtime.py']

    img_backbone=dict(
        type='ResNet',

            pts_channels=64,

        in_channels=256,
        layer_nums=[5, 5],
        layer_strides=[1, 2],
        out_channels=[128, 256]),
    pts_neck=dict(
        type='SECONDFPN',
        in_channels=[128, 256],
        upsample_strides=[1, 2],
        out_channels=[256, 256]),
    pts_bbox_head=dict(
        type='Anchor3DHead',
        num_classes=3,

        loss_dir=dict(
            type='CrossEntropyLoss', use_sigmoid=False, loss_weight=0.2)),

    dict(type='LoadImageFromFile'),

    test=dict(
        type=dataset_type,

        split='training',
        pts_prefix='velodyne_reduced',
        pipeline=test_pipeline,
        modality=input_modality,
        classes=class_names,
        test_mode=True,
        box_type_3d='LiDAR'))

# Training settings
optimizer = dict(weight_decay=0.01)
# max_norm=10 is better for SECOND
optimizer_config = dict(grad_clip=dict(max_norm=35, norm_type=2))

evaluation = dict(interval=5, pipeline=eval_pipeline)
```

### Reproduces the problem - command or script

using distributed training, the command are as follow:
`./tools/dist_train.sh /mnt/maoyucheng/mmdetection3d-0.17.0/configs/mvxnet/dv_mvx-fpn_second_secfpn_adamw_2x8_80e_kitti-3d-3class.py 8`

### Additional information

Following some of the solutions available on the web, I lowered the ```samples_per_gpu```and ```workers_per_gpu``` in the config ,but it shows the same result. Also, I have tried the newest vision of mmdetection3d and got the same result.

title: Fix PonitRCNN GPU memory occupancy problem
body:
Thanks for your contribution and we appreciate it a lot. The following instructions would make your pull request more healthy and more easily get feedback. If you do not understand some items, don't worry, just make the pull request and seek help from maintainers.

## Motivation

Fix PonitRCNN GPU memory occupancy problem. Issue #1907

title: AssertionError: Input boxes shape should be [N, 5] when train point_rcnn
body:
**Describe the bug**
This error appears when train point_rcnn using kitti.
The input shape of NMS in [point_rpn_head.py](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/c20b6cb637fa31b88b1c7b523116f4f606010094/mmdet3d/models/dense_heads/point_rpn_head.py#L340) is N\*7, while NMS function in [mmcv](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmcv/blob/235c0253ab8806a2a2ee6954b4258a95358497ac/mmcv/ops/iou3d.py#L50) only accept input with shape N\*5 

**Reproduction**
mmdetection3d==1.0.0rc1
mmcv==1.4.8

title: Bug in BasePoints.rotate
body: Looks like the rotation matrix [here](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/master/mmdet3d/core/points/base_points.py#L168) is wrong. The `1` value should be in (0, 0) coordinates, not (2, 0). Am i right?

title: RandomFlip3D doesn't work for segmentation task
body:
Looks like this [empty_box](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/master/mmdet3d/datasets/pipelines/transforms_3d.py#L117) hack is not working for segmentation task as `box_type_3d` is not defined. So, probably here we want to flip point not throw `BaseInstance3DBoxes` but throw `BasePoints`:
```python
if 'box_type_3d' not in input_dict:
    input_dict['points'].flip(direction)
    return
```

body: I'm implementing a custom pgd_head based on the pgd_head you provide. I might misunderstand the code, but please take a look.

title: Dual GPU cuda core dumped.
body:
I am on a dual GPU system with pytorch 1.10 and cuda 1.13
When I run inference_detector on centerpoint with device=cuda:1 it exits upon this exception.
I have no issue when running the same code on cuda:0.

Both GPU are the same model with the same drivers installed.


**Checklist**
1. I have searched related issues but cannot get the expected help.
2. The bug has not been fixed in the latest version.

**Describe the bug**
Program exits after error. Traceback provided below.

**Reproduction**
1. What command or script did you run?
I run 

```python
    # build the model from a config file and a checkpoint 
    CONFIG = '/mmdetection3d/configs/centerpoint/centerpoint_01voxel_second_secfpn_circlenms_4x8_cyclic_20e_nus.py'
    CHECKPOINT = '/mmdetection3d/checkpoints/centerpoint_01voxel_second_secfpn_circlenms_4x8_cyclic_20e_nus_20201001_135205-5db91e00.pth'
    model = init_model(CONFIG, CHECKPOINT, device='cuda:1')
    pointcloud = '/my/pointcloud.bin'
    result, data = inference_detector(self.model, pointcloud)
```

2. Did you make any modifications on the code or config? Did you understand what you have modified?
I didn't.
3. What dataset did you use?
Custom dataset.
**Environment**

1. Please run `python mmdet3d/utils/collect_env.py` to collect necessary environment infomation and paste it here.
2. You may add addition that may be helpful for locating the problem, such as
    - How you installed PyTorch [e.g., pip, conda, source]
    - Other environment variables that may be related (such as `$PATH`, `$LD_LIBRARY_PATH`, `$PYTHONPATH`, etc.)

**Error traceback**
If applicable, paste the error trackback here.
```bash
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'c10::CUDAError'
  what():  CUDA error: an illegal memory access was encountered
CUDA kernel errors might be asynchronously reported at some other API call,so the stacktrace below might be incorrect.
For debugging consider passing CUDA_LAUNCH_BLOCKING=1.
Exception raised from create_event_internal at /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1634272168290/work/c10/cuda/CUDACachingAllocator.cpp:1211 (most recent call first):
frame #0: c10::Error::Error(c10::SourceLocation, std::string) + 0x42 (0x7f52d2b97d62 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libc10.so)
frame #1: <unknown function> + 0x1c613 (0x7f52d2dfa613 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libc10_cuda.so)
frame #2: c10::cuda::CUDACachingAllocator::raw_delete(void*) + 0x1a2 (0x7f52d2dfb022 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libc10_cuda.so)
frame #3: c10::TensorImpl::release_resources() + 0xa4 (0x7f52d2b81314 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libc10.so)
frame #4: <unknown function> + 0x294dd9 (0x7f5257750dd9 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libtorch_python.so)
frame #5: <unknown function> + 0xae2f59 (0x7f5257f9ef59 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libtorch_python.so)
frame #6: THPVariable_subclass_dealloc(_object*) + 0x2b9 (0x7f5257f9f279 in /home/cavride/anaconda3/envs/mmlab/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/lib/libtorch_python.so)
<omitting python frames>
frame #31: __libc_start_main + 0xe7 (0x7f52e8255bf7 in /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6)
Aborted (core dumped)
```


**Bug fix**
I checked what was the current device in init_model after model.to(device) with:
```python
    print(f'HELLO I AM MMDETECTION3D {torch.cuda.current_device()}')
````
and it always printed 0 regardless of the device I entered.

I fixed my issue adding this line right before model.to(device)  of init_model() in inference.py :
```python
    torch.cuda.set_device(device)
    model.to(device)
```
If I print the torch.cuda.current_device() after the fix it now is 0 or 1 accordingly! :)

    - How you installed PyTorch [e.g., pip, conda, source]
    - Other environment variables that may be related (such as `$PATH`, `$LD_LIBRARY_PATH`, `$PYTHONPATH`, etc.)

**Error traceback**
If applicable, paste the error trackback here.

**Bug fix**
If you have already identified the reason, you can provide the information here. If you are willing to create a PR to fix it, please also leave a comment here and that would be much appreciated!

In `/tools/data_converter/sunrgbd_data_utils.py` should probably make changes in this function:
```
def get_calibration(self, idx):
        calib_filepath = osp.join(self.calib_dir, f'{idx:06d}.txt')
        lines = [line.rstrip() for line in open(calib_filepath)]
        Rt = np.array([float(x) for x in lines[0].split(' ')])
        Rt = np.reshape(Rt, (3, 3), order='F').astype(np.float32)
        K = np.array([float(x) for x in lines[1].split(' ')])
        K = np.reshape(Rt, (3, 3), order='F').astype(np.float32)
        return K, Rt
```
To get this:
```
def get_calibration(self, idx):
        calib_filepath = osp.join(self.calib_dir, f'{idx:06d}.txt')
        lines = [line.rstrip() for line in open(calib_filepath)]
        Rt = np.array([float(x) for x in lines[0].split(' ')])
        Rt = np.reshape(Rt, (3, 3), order='F').astype(np.float32)
        K = np.array([float(x) for x in lines[1].split(' ')])
        K = np.reshape(K, (3, 3), order='F').astype(np.float32)
        return K, Rt
```

title: The collapse of the AOS evaluation for 3DSSD
body:
The evaluation log of 3DSSD for kitti with default config is below.

> Car AP@0.70, 0.70, 0.70:
bbox AP:96.6093, 89.8885, 89.2153
bev  AP:90.2018, 87.8845, 86.5672
3d   AP:88.7361, 78.3761, 77.1837
aos  AP:0.34, 0.52, 0.88
Car AP@0.70, 0.50, 0.50:
bbox AP:96.6093, 89.8885, 89.2153
bev  AP:96.7122, 90.0748, 89.5853
3d   AP:96.6553, 90.0317, 89.5103
aos  AP:0.34, 0.52, 0.88

The result of aos is so weird that I want to know where there are bugs here.
And how about the AOS result of other models?

title: frame's timestamp value loses its precision when cast from int64 to np.float32 during the conversion of Waymo dataset
body:
Hi, 

It looks like a small bug exists here. Waymo dataset uses type int64 for timestamp, but the following code casts its value from int64 to float64 at line 239 (behavior of numpy v1.18.5, though intensity is float32), and at line 247 casts its value further from float64 to float32.

For a typical waymo frame timestamp value, e.g. 1550083467346370, will lose precision and be cast into 1550083493462016. A big value of similar range has a low precision of 134,217,728 (physically 134s) when represented by float32.

This should have little impact though. But I found that the output waymo_infos_*.pkl files are affected, in which nearly all frames has the same issue: they and their previous 'sweeps' have exactly the same timestamp.
 
https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/1b39a483263825ac5a3e57fdf07d380adb7aa16d/tools/data_converter/waymo_converter.py#L236-L247

title: possible bug in indoor_eval
body:
Looks like [`eval_map_recall`](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/master/mmdet3d/core/evaluation/indoor_eval.py#L163) function is incorrect in case of `gt.keys() != pred.keys()`.
For example if `gt.keys() == [2, 4]` and `pred.keys() == [4]` then `len(ret_values) == 1` and when `i == 1` we get `RuntimeError` in [`ret_values[i]`](https://github.com/open-mmlab/mmdetection3d/blob/master/mmdet3d/core/evaluation/indoor_eval.py#L194).
If you also think it is a bug, i can make a pull request to fix it.

title: Wrong 'img_pad_shape'  in PointFusion!
body:
**Describe the bug**
I saw the code about 'MVXNet' which fuses the feature of lidar and image (mmdetection3d.configs.mvxnet). Its  fusion method is 'PointFusion' which associates points and pixels by projection (mmdet3d.models.fusion_layers.point_fusion.py line 322). Its image data augumentation methods include Resizing, Flipping, Padding, so the coordinates on image obtained by projection should perform the same operation (mmdet3d.models.fusion_layers.point_fusion.py line 85). However, the Padding operate outputs tensors with different shapes, the smaller tensor will be padded again to keep the same shape before passed into the model (mmcv.parallel.collate.py line 42). We should adopt the 'input shape' instead of 'pad shape'!

**Reproduction**
I set batchsize to 2, you can view the data when collating the batch data (mmcv.parallel.collate.py line 80). Then you will find the same ori_shape (375, 1242), different pad_shapes (416, 1344) and (576, 1856), the same input_shape (576, 1856).


**Bug fix**
Change the 'pad shape' to 'input shape' (mmdet3d.models.fusion_layers.point_fusion.py line 333).
